title: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PS4) - Before You Buy
author: @CxerRy96
comment:
3:46 THIS...this is the most important tip for any new player of PUBG and similar games...

When i first started playing i was aware that i'd be bad so what i did was drop in the least populated areas of the zones avoiding anyone until absolutely necessary...

My fear of getting killed too "early" made me play extremely passive so what ended up happening was, i would survive a decent ammount of time, i would get really good loot most of the time because i would explore the areas alone, i also learned to work the maps really well...

But when it came down to shooting i always lost the gunfight because i didn't have any experience with weapons like what range are they good at, how fast did they kill, what attachment to use and so on...

Then a friend of mine who is among the top ranked players played with me and for the next like 100 games he forced me to jump into hotspots (like Schoo, Hacienda, Bootcamp and so on) to learn how to shoot, react quicker and also read enemies movement...

Not only did this drastically improve my gameplay it also taught me to have confidence in myself no matter the situation...
